comments.content:
To me it looks like a regular kind of Avant Garde with some alternative glyphs... Elsner+Flake released this I gues...

150watt.net

By the way, the spacing in that sample image is off from the original logotype. The original spacing can be seen on this page:

[http://www.creativepro.com/article/dot-font-type-that-s-tight-but-not-to...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081017120953/http:/www.creativepro.com/article/dot-font-type-that-s-tight-but-not-touching "http://www.creativepro.com/article/dot-font-type-that-s-tight-but-not-touching")

Note how the letters line up between the two lines.

While searching for this, I found some funny “avant garde” examples:

[http://www.avantgardeprivatehire.co.uk/Default.asp?Page=13](http://web.archive.org/web/20081017120953/http:/www.avantgardeprivatehire.co.uk/Default.asp?Page=13 "http://www.avantgardeprivatehire.co.uk/Default.asp?Page=13")

[http://www.chezamyl.com/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081017120953/http:/www.chezamyl.com/index.html "http://www.chezamyl.com/index.html")

[http://www.avantgardeoutfitters.com/scripts/openExtra.asp?extra=1](http://web.archive.org/web/20081017120953/http:/www.avantgardeoutfitters.com/scripts/openExtra.asp?extra=1 "http://www.avantgardeoutfitters.com/scripts/openExtra.asp?extra=1")

...from the pick-the-font-that’s-the-same-as-the-name-of-the-business school of design. The last one is probably a trademark infringement, although it doesn’t look like they are actually a going concern.
